name: Ankle Eversion Isometric (Wall Push)
setup: Stand sideways next to a wall with the outside of the foot near the wall
Feet hip-width; slight knee softness; tall posture
Place the outer edge of the foot/lightly the ankle against the wall (pain-free)
steps: Gently press the outside of your foot into the wall as if turning the sole outward (eversion)
Ramp tension from light to moderate over 2 seconds—no pain spike
Hold for the prescribed time while breathing steadily
Release slowly and relax before the next effort
mistakes: Leaning body into wall instead of using ankle
safety: Isometrics should be pain-free or minimal discomfort ≤ 2–3/10. Use very light pressure initially and stop if pain increases during or after.

regressions: Seated eversion isometric with towel between foot and wall
Very light fingertip support and micro-pressure

prescriptionHints.notes: Place a folded towel between foot and wall if sensitive

joints.notes: Maintain arch and ankle alignment; do not jam into end range
